### Steps to reproduce

brew install neovim --HEAD

### Expected behavior

build successfully

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NA

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macOS 14.6.1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.36.2

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

homebrew

comment_data.body: HEAD builds are not supported with homebrew. Stick to releases or wait until this resolves itself.

head build is supported via homebrew , you need switch to master version of uft8proc. because bfredl make some change of this lib.

```
brew uninstall utf8proc 
brew install utf8proc --HEAD
```

> head build is supported via homebrew

No. Neither us nor homebrew officially support `brew install --HEAD`. You can work around stuff, of course, but it's important to set expectations properly.
It's still not supported; use at your own risk, things _will_ break.

This is broken beyond just `brew install neovim --HEAD`; simply running `brew upgrade neovim` on a previous working installation fails as well:
```
==> Upgrading neovim
  HEAD-e016f5b -> HEAD-4c5bce9
==> cmake -S . -B build -DLUV_LIBRARY=/opt/homebrew/opt/luv/lib/libluv.dylib -DLIBUV_LIBRARY=/opt/homebrew/opt/libuv/lib/libuv.dylib -DLPEG_LIBRARY=/opt/homebrew/opt/lpeg/lib/liblpeg.dylib
==> cmake --build build
Last 15 lines from /Users/james.obeirne/Library/Logs/Homebrew/neovim/02.cmake:
                        ~~~~  ^
/tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/src/nvim/mbyte.c:488:41: error: no member named 'ambiguous_width' in 'struct utf8proc_property_struct'
  if (p_emoji && c >= 0x1f000 && !prop->ambiguous_width && prop_is_emojilike(prop)) {
                                  ~~~~  ^
/tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/src/nvim/mbyte.c:1352:15: error: no member named 'ambiguous_width' in 'struct utf8proc_property_struct'
    if (prop->ambiguous_width || prop_is_emojilike(prop)) {
        ~~~~  ^
3 errors generated.
make[2]: *** [src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/mbyte.c.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
[ 80%] Building C object src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/msgpack_rpc/server.c.o
cd /tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/build/src/nvim && /opt/homebrew/Library/Homebrew/shims/mac/super/clang -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -DUNIT_TESTING -DUTF8PROC_STATIC -D_GNU_SOURCE -Dnvim_bin_EXPORTS -I/tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/build/src/nvim/auto -I/tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/build/include -I/tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/build/cmake.config -I/tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/src -isystem /opt/homebrew/include/luajit-2.1 -isystem /opt/homebrew/opt/gettext/include -O3 -DNDEBUG -flto=thin -arch arm64 -isysroot /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/SDKs/MacOSX14.sdk -mmacosx-version-min=14.6.1 -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wvla -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -fsigned-char -fstack-protector-strong -Wimplicit-fallthrough -fdiagnostics-color=auto -MD -MT src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/msgpack_rpc/server.c.o -MF CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/msgpack_rpc/server.c.o.d -o CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/msgpack_rpc/server.c.o -c /tmp/neovim-20240910-37582-xtwzfs/src/nvim/msgpack_rpc/server.c
make[1]: *** [src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2
```

The `utf8proc` workaround above fixes it though.
that log.. literally says it's a HEAD version.

labels.description: current behavior is by design, and change is not desired
labels.name: closed:wontfix

title: HEAD build error via homebrew
